dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 6215 IH: No American Climate Corps Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Good of Virginia (for himself, Mr. Ogles, Mrs. Miller of Illinois, Mr. Higgins of Louisiana, Mr. Bishop of North Carolina, Mr. Weber of Texas, Mr. Rosendale, Mr. Norman, Mr. Mooney, Mr. Clyde, Mr. Biggs, Mr. Jackson of Texas, Mr. Gosar, Mr. Cloud, Mrs. Lesko, Mr. Donalds, Mr. Nehls, Mr. Crane, Mr. Gooden of Texas, and Mr. Burlison) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committees on Natural Resources, Education and the Workforce, and Oversight and Accountability, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To prohibit Federal funds from being made available for the Justice40 Initiative or for the American Climate Corps.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No American Climate Corps Act.

section.header: American Climate Corps and Justice40 Initiative funding prohibition
section.text: No Federal funds may be used forâ€”

paragraph.text: the Justice40 Initiative (as described in Executive Order 14008 (86 Fed. Reg. 7619, relating to tackling the climate crisis)); or
the American Climate Corps (as described in the fact sheet published by the White House on September 20, 2023, relating to the American Climate Corps).
